name: add_to_global_variable_list
description:
Adds the event target to a variable list for the given duration
add_to_variable_list = { name = X target = Y days/weeks/months/years = Z }
Where X is the name of the variable
Where Y is an event target
An optional days where Z is the number of days or script value

name: add_to_list
description:
Adds the current scope to an arbitrarily-named list (or creates the list if not already present) to be referenced later in the (unbroken) event chain
add_to_list = <name_of_list>
add_to_list = { name = <name_of_list> value = <script_value> }
NOTE, if adding a permanent target to a temporary list, the whole list becomes permanent

name: add_to_local_variable_list
description:
Adds the event target to a variable list for the given duration
add_to_variable_list = { name = X target = Y days/weeks/months/years = Z }
Where X is the name of the variable
Where Y is an event target
An optional days where Z is the number of days or script value

name: add_to_temporary_list
description:
Adds the current scope to an arbitrarily-named list (or creates the list if not already present) to be referenced later in the same effect
add_to_temporary_list = <name_of_list>
add_to_temporary_list = { name = <name_of_list> value = <script_value> }
NOTE, if adding a temporary target to a permanent list, the list will stay permanent

name: add_to_variable_list

"starts the construction of the specified building in the location.

	building_type = scoped building type
	cost_multiplier = value
	cost_multiplier_reason = loc key
	demand_multiplier = value
	instant = yes/no
	owner = country # defaults to location owner
	payer = country # defaults to building owner
}"

name: custom_description
description:
Wraps effects that get a custom description instead of the auto-generated one
custom_description = {
	text = <effect_localization_key>
	subject = <optional subject scope> #defaults to current scope
	object = <optional object scope>
	value = <optional script value>
	... effects ...
}

name: custom_description_no_bullet
description:
Wraps effects that get a custom description instead of the auto-generated one. Also ensures no bullet point appears
custom_description_no_bullet = {
	text = <effect_localization_key>
	subject = <optional subject scope> #defaults to current scope
	object = <optional object scope>
	value = <optional script value>
	... effects ...
}

name: custom_label
description:
just a tooltip, the scope as object (for grouping, localization).
custom_label = key; alternatively custom_label = { text = key subject = scope (optional) <hidden effects> }

name: custom_tooltip

just a tooltip, the scope as subject (for grouping, localization).

name: execute_prisoners
description: Prisoners get executed

name: execute_propose_effect
description: Execute the popose_effect of any implementable object (policies, avatar, cabinet_action, estate_privilege, god, government_reform). Usage: execute_propose_effect = { source = <implementable object id> [<flag> = <scope>] }

name: extend_regency
description: extends the regency by X years

name: finalize_resolution
description: End the target resolution for the current situation or international organization.

name: find_route
description: Finds route between start location and closest eligible end location { start = <location> end = <location trigger> limit = <location trigger> with scope:from provided for previous location and scope:distance for distance, weight = <location scriptvalue> that modifies the provided scope:distance and has scope:to location effect = <location effect> which fires for every location in the resulting path with scope:from and scope:to provided when possible. }

name: fire_generic_action
description: fires a generic action with the country as the actor and the supplied thing as the recipient

name: floodfill_locations
description: Generates a list of floodfilled locations from adjacencies. Needs a limit specified to avoid floodfilling everything.

name: force_city_gfx_rebuild
description: Rebuilds the city gfx

name: force_recalc_country_active_status
description: Recalculates active country status

name: force_refresh_culture_and_religion
description: Recalculates dominant relgion and culture in a location

name: force_union
description: Current country scope forces a union with the target scope. In case of a union merge, the country which forces the union keeps the ruler.

name: form_country
description: Forms a new country (using formable system)

name: form_new_culture
description: Creates a new culture in this country from the primary culture

name: found_dynasty
description: Makes the character found a new dynasty. If no name is specified, it will be named after the character's birth Location, but the effect still needs to be inside curly brackets

name: garrison_sortie
description:
"The defender of the siege in scope executes a garrison sortie.
This creates a unit with fort garrison and attacks the sieging armies.
If the siege defender loses this combat, the fort will be instantly occupied by the siege attacker.
example:
<siege_scope> = { garrison_sortie = yes }
"

name: give_loan
description: gives a loan of { target = country amount = gold interest = percent months = months }

name: grant_estate_privilege
description: grants a special estate priviledge.

name: grant_parliament_agenda
description: Accept the specified target parliament agenda.

name: grant_parliament_agenda_for_estate
description: Accept the parliament agenda of the target estate type.

name: grant_parliament_agenda_for_special_status
description: Accept the parliament agenda of the target special status type.

name: hidden_effect

description: hires a mercenary for the target country

name: hire_prisoners_as_mercenaries
description: Prisoners become mercenaries for the supplied country

name: hire_privateer

name: join_war_as_attacker
description: joins the target war as an attacker. Usage: join_war_as_attacker = { war = war scope call_in_subjects = yes/no }

name: join_war_as_defender
description: joins the target war as a defender. Usage: join_war_as_defender = { war = war scope call_in_subjects = yes/no }

name: join_war_with
description: joins the target war as an ally of the target country. Usage: join_war_with = { war = war scope target = country scope call_in_subjects = yes/no }

name: kill_character

name: kill_character_silently
description: Kills the target character without message popups. Usage: kill_character = <character> or kill_character = { target = <character> [location = <location>] [disease = <disease>] [killer = <character>] [reason = <reason>] }

description: leaves a war, forced by another country. Usage: leave_war = { war = <war> actor = <country forcing them to do it> }

name: make_subject_of

name: random_list
description:
randomly choose effects from a list
random_list = {
    10 = {                  # defines an option with base chance 10
       trigger = { ... }    # optional trigger to enable/disable this option
       modifier = { ... }   # optional MTTH-style modifier for the chance. Any special modifiers work here as well
       min = 5              # optional number to constrain this option's chance after applying modifiers
       max = 20             # optional number to constrain this option's chance after applying modifiers
       desc = loc_key       # optional loc key to insert into this option's effect description
       show_chance = yes/no # whether to show this option's chance in the effect description, default is yes
       effects...           # effects to run if this option is picked
    }
    5 = { ... }             # another option with base chance 5, so half as likely as the first one
    desc = loc_key          # optional way to override the default header for the effect description
    pick = 3                # how many options to pick, default is 1
    unique = yes/no         # require picked entries to be unique, if pick > 1, default is no
}

description: Starts the tutorial lesson with the given key. Does nothing if the tutorial is not running, the lesson is completed (or already running), or the lesson cannot be triggered (e.g. trigger fails)

name: start_weather_system
description: Starts off a new weather system. Usage: start_weather_system = { width = <pixels> length = <pixels> strength = [0..1] speed = <pixels per day> type = <front/cyclone/tornado> location = <start location> location = <waypoint> [location = <waypoint>...] }

name: start_work_of_art
description: Makes the target character start working on some art. start_work_of_art = { work_of_art_type = work_of_art_type:<type> (optional, will start a random type of WoA if not set) quality = <calc> (optional, will take artist skill into consideration if unset) show_quality = yes/no (by default no, shows the probable quality of the WoA before it is finished) }

name: stop_annexing_country
description: scope country stops annexing the target country

name: stop_cabinet_action
description: Stop the cabinet doing stuff

name: stop_tutorial
description: Stops the tutorial.

name: support_rebel
description: scope country starts supporting the target rebel

name: switch
take_over_all_wars
description: takes over all wars where target country is warleader

name: test_log
description: Log a string to the test log when this effect executes, test_log = message, the message can be a localization string with ROOT, SCOPE and PREV available. Usage: test_log = { name = <test key> text = <custom log message> }

name: transfer_yearly_gold
description: Transfers a proportion of your yearly gold to the target country

name: transfer_yearly_manpower
description: Transfers a proportion of your yearly Manpower to the target country

name: transfer_yearly_sailors
description: Transfers a proportion of your yearly sailors to the target country

name: trigger_event_non_silently
description:
triggers an event or on_action, but shows the name of the event
trigger_event_non_silently = { id = X days/months/years = Y } (for events)

name: trigger_event_silently
description:
triggers an event or on_action
trigger_event = { id = X days/months/years = Y } (for events)
or
trigger_event = { on_action = X days/months/years = Y } (for on_actions)
Days/months/years are optional and equal to 0 if not specified. If specified, Y can be a value or an inclusive interval "{ A B }" from which the duration will be picked randomly.

name: unlock_unit
description: Unlocks a locked Unit

name: unset_participated_in_parliament
description: Remove the mark of the country as having participated in the parliament of the target international organization.

name: while
white_peace
description: forces a white peace in the target war
